message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it presents a system that partitions DNN models across multiple GPU devices to reduce per-GPU memory footprint. It also proposes a recursive search algorithm that minimizes the total communication cost, which is a common problem in distributed computing. 

The paper is also likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it focuses on training very large CNN and RNN models. 

Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) is another likely sub-category as CNN models are commonly used in computer vision tasks. 

Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also a possible sub-category as DNN models are a popular tool in AI research. 

Finally, Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with optimizing the training of neural networks.
